prompt: Create a header with a black background and white text that includes a search bar, links to the documentation, support, and contact page

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should have a simple and elegant design with a prominent search bar at the top. The header should have a black background with white text to create high contrast and make the text easily readable. The search bar should be center-aligned and have a slight rounded edge to give it a smooth look. The links to documentation, support, and contact page should be placed on the right side of the header and should be easily accessible. **Components:** 1. **HeaderView** (Standalone): The top-level header component that contains the search bar and links. 2. **SearchBar** (Takes Children): The search input field with a submit button. 3. **LinkGroup** (Takes Children): A group of links to documentation, support, and contact page. **Top-level UI HTML:** ```html
{children} {children}
``` **Component HTML:** - **HeaderView** (Standalone): ```html
{children}
``` - **SearchBar** (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - **LinkGroup** (Takes Children): ```html
  • Documentation
  • Support
  • Contact
    • {children}
``` Note: `{documentationUrl}`, `{supportUrl}`, and `{contactUrl}` should be replaced with the actual URL values.

prompt: Call-to-action (CTA) buttons with a white outline and neon green text

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should display a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button that grabs the user's attention. The button should have a white outline and neon green text to create a striking visual effect. The button should be centered on the screen and have sufficient padding to make it easily clickable on mobile devices. On larger screens, the button should be larger and more prominent. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** * `CtaButton` (Standalone): A call-to-action button with a white outline and neon green text. On mobile devices (sm: prefix), the button should be relatively small with a fixed width. On larger screens (md: and up), the button should be larger and centered horizontally. **What does the HTML for top level UI look like?** ```html
``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - `CtaButton` (Standalone): ```html ``` Note: The `ButtonText` prop is used to pass the text content of the button.

prompt: A star rating component to display course ratings

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The star rating component should be a compact, visually appealing representation of a course's rating. It should be easily readable on various screen sizes and accessible to all users. The component will feature a row of stars, with the number of filled stars indicating the course's rating. The color scheme will include a highlight color for the filled stars and a secondary color for the unfilled stars. **Components** * `StarRating` (Takes Children): A container for the star rating component. * `Star` (Standalone): An individual star in the rating system. **Top-level UI HTML** ```html ``` **Component HTML** * `StarRating` (Takes Children): ```html
{children} {average_rating} / 5
``` * `Star` (Standalone): ```html
{filled ? ★ : ★}
``` Note: The `★` is a Unicode character for a star. The `filled` variable will be a boolean indicating whether the star should be filled (yellow) or unfilled (gray).

prompt: A logo component with a simple, white icon and a custom font for the logotype

message.content:
Here's the design for the logo component: **What should the UI look like?** The logo component should be a compact, rectangular element that contains a simple, white icon alongside a custom font for the logotype. The icon should be prominently displayed on the left side of the component, with the logotype text aligned vertically alongside it. The component should scale well on different screen sizes, with the icon and logotype text resizing proportionally to fit the available space. **Components** * `LogoComponent` (Standalone): A self-contained component that renders a logo with an icon and logotype text. **HTML for top-level UI** ```html
``` **HTML for each component** * `LogoComponent` (Standalone): ```html
{logotype_text}
``` Note: `{brand_color}`, `{icon_name}`, and `{logotype_text}` are placeholders for the actual values, which can be replaced with the desired values.

prompt: Create a section header component with a green background, white text, and a subtle gradient effect

message.content:
Here's the response: **What should the UI look like?** The SectionHeader component should have a prominent, modern design that stands out from the rest of the UI. It should have a green background with a subtle gradient effect to give it a sense of depth. The text should be white to provide sufficient contrast with the green background. The component should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes, ensuring that the text remains readable and the gradient effect is preserved. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - SectionHeader (Standalone): This component displays a prominent section header with a green background, white text, and a subtle gradient effect. **What does the HTML for the top level UI look like?** ```html Section Title ``` **What is the HTML for each component?** - SectionHeader (Standalone): ```html

{children}

``` Note: I've used Tailwind CSS classes to style the component. The `bg-gradient-to-r` class creates a gradient effect from green-400 to green-500, and `text-white` sets the text color to white. `py-4` and `px-6` add padding to the component, while `rounded-md` gives it a soft, rounded corner. The `h2` element is used to display the section title, and `{children}` is a placeholder for the actual title text.

prompt: A modal window with a white background and a close button to display additional information

message.content:
Here's the design and implementation of a modal window with a white background and a close button: **What should the UI look like?** The UI should be a modal window that overlays the main content, with a white background and a close button at the top right corner. The modal window should be centered vertically and horizontally on the screen. On smaller screens, the modal window should take up the full width of the screen. **Components** 1. `ModalContainer` (Standalone): This component is the outermost container of the modal window. It should have a white background and a close button at the top right corner. 2. `ModalCloseButton` (Standalone): This component is the close button at the top right corner of the modal window. 3. `ModalContent` (Takes Children): This component is the content area of the modal window, where additional information will be displayed. **HTML for top level UI** ```html
{children}
``` **HTML for each component** - `ModalContainer` (Standalone): ```html
{children}
``` - `ModalCloseButton` (Standalone): ```html ``` - `ModalContent` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note that we're using Tailwind CSS classes to style the components. We're also using `aria-hidden="true"` on the close button to make it accessible to screen readers.

prompt: Header that includes a logo, search bar, and navigation links to the homepage, about us, and contact us

message.content:
Here's the design and implementation of the header component: **What should the UI look like?** The header should be a compact bar that spans the full width of the screen. It should include a logo on the left, a search bar in the center, and navigation links to the homepage, about us, and contact us on the right. The header should be responsive, with the search bar and navigation links stacking on top of each other on smaller screens. **Individual components and their behaviors** 1. `Header`: The top-level header component, which contains the logo, search bar, and navigation links. (Takes Children) * On small screens, the header takes up the full width of the screen, with the search bar and navigation links stacked below the logo. * On medium and large screens, the header is fixed to the top of the screen, with the search bar and navigation links side by side with the logo. 2. `Logo`: The logo component, which displays the website's logo. (Standalone) * On all screens, the logo is displayed on the left side of the header, with a fixed width and height. 3. `SearchBar`: The search bar component, which allows users to search the website. (Takes Children) * On small screens, the search bar is displayed below the logo, taking up the full width of the screen. * On medium and large screens, the search bar is displayed alongside the logo, with a fixed width. 4. `NavLinks`: The navigation links component, which displays links to the homepage, about us, and contact us. (Takes Children) * On small screens, the navigation links are displayed below the search bar, with each link on a separate line. * On medium and large screens, the navigation links are displayed alongside the search bar, with each link separated by a vertical bar. **HTML for top-level UI** ```html
Homepage About Us Contact Us
``` **HTML for each component** - `Header` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - `Logo` (Standalone): ```html ``` - `SearchBar` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - `NavLinks` (Takes Children): ```html
    {children}
```

prompt: Create a product image gallery component that displays multiple images of a product

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The product image gallery component should display multiple high-quality images of a product, showcasing different angles and details. The images should be displayed in a responsive, intuitive, and accessible manner. On smaller screens, the images should be displayed in a vertical carousel, and on larger screens, they should be displayed in a horizontal carousel. The component should include navigation controls (previous and next buttons) to allow the user to navigate through the images. The component should also highlight the currently selected image. **Components:** 1. `ProductImageGallery` (Takes Children): The top-level component that wraps the image gallery. * Small screen (sm:): Vertical carousel with navigation controls at the bottom. * Medium screen (md:): Horizontal carousel with navigation controls at the bottom. * Large screen (lg:): Horizontal carousel with navigation controls at the top. * Extra Large screen (xl:): Horizontal carousel with navigation controls at the top. 2. `GalleryImage` (Takes Children): An individual image in the gallery. * Small screen (sm:): Image is full-width and stacked vertically. * Medium screen (md:), Large screen (lg:), and Extra Large screen (xl:): Image is displayed inline-block with a fixed width. **Top-level HTML:** ```html
``` **Component HTML:** - `ProductImageGallery` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - `GalleryImage` (Takes Children): ```html ```

prompt: A category grid component that displays a list of categories (e.g. tents, backpacks, clothing) with icons and short descriptions

message.content:
**What should the UI look like?** The UI should be a responsive grid that adapts to different screen sizes, with a clean and minimal design that puts focus on the categories. Each category should have an icon, a short description, and ample whitespace to make the content breathe. The icons should be colorful and attention-grabbing, while the descriptions should be clear and concise. The grid should scale well on different screen sizes, with a maximum of 3-4 columns on larger screens and 1-2 columns on smaller screens. **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** 1. `CategoryGrid` (Takes Children): The top-level component that contains the grid of categories. 2. `CategoryCard` (Takes Children): An individual category component that contains an icon, description, and optional call-to-action. **HTML for the top level UI** ```html ``` **HTML for each component** - `CategoryGrid` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` - `CategoryCard` (Takes Children): ```html
{category_icon}

{category_name}

{category_description}

{call_to_action}
``` Note: `{category_color}`, `{category_icon}`, `{category_name}`, `{category_description}`, and `{call_to_action}` are placeholders for the actual values.

prompt: Reactions component with like, love, and haha buttons

message.content:
Here is a potential UI design for a Reactions component: **What should the UI look like?** The Reactions component should be a compact, rounded rectangle with three buttons for liking, loving, and laughing. The buttons should be easily tappable on mobile devices. On larger screens, the component should scale up slightly to make the buttons more prominent. The component should have a subtle shadow to give it a slight lift. **Individual Components:** * `ReactionButton` (Standalone): A single reaction button with an emoji and text indicating the reaction type (e.g., "Like", "Love", "Haha"). * `Reactions` (Takes Children): A container for the reaction buttons, with a subtle background and rounded corners. **Top-level HTML:** ```html
üëç {like_count} Likes ‚ù§Ô∏è {love_count} Loves üòÇ {haha_count} Hahas
``` **Component HTML:** - `ReactionButton` (Standalone): ```html ``` - `Reactions` (Takes Children): ```html
{children}
``` Note: The `Reactions` component takes children, which in this case are the `ReactionButton` components. The `ReactionButton` component is standalone and would be reused for each reaction type. The `{emoji}`, `{text}`, and `{count}` placeholders would be replaced with the actual values for each reaction type.
